But living in her native Brazil, which leads the world in homicidal violence, she realized she couldn't just stand by and watch drugs and guns tear her country apart. Szabó de Carvalho reveals four crucial lessons she learned when she left her cushy job and took a fearless stand against the status quo.", "event": "TEDGlobal 2014", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "Ilona Szabó de Carvalho: 4 lessons I learned from taking a stand against drugs and gun violence", "slug": "ilona_szabo_de_carvalho_4_lessons_i_learned_from_taking_a_stand_against_drugs_and_gun_violence", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "2039", "slug": "ilona_szabo_de_carvalho", "is_published": true, "firstname": "Ilona", "lastname": "Szabó de Carvalho", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Civic entrepreneur", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/0e34c20b35569e501f309abcdfec079ddd416221_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "Ilona Szabó de Carvalho designs solutions for some of the world's biggest challenges -- from reducing violence and reforming drug laws to renewing democracy and fighting polarization.", "whylisten": "

Ilona Szabó de Carvalho is the cofounder and executive director of the Igarapé Institute, a "think-and-do" tank based in Brazil. She also cofounded Agora, a political movement of young leaders advancing innovative, evidence-based public policy. In her work, she tackles issues like responsible firearms regulation, criminal justice and progressive drug policy. She coordinated the Global Commission on Drug Policy from 2011-2016, reaching out to presidents, business leaders and civic groups to rethink the war on drugs. 
  
In addition to her column with Folha de Sao Paulo, Szabó de Carvalho is the author of Drugs: The Untold Stories and Public Security to Change the Game. In 2014, she gave her first TED Talk, and in 2015, she was nominated to be a Young Global Leader at the World Economic Forum.

"https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/0e34c20b35569e501f309abcdfec079ddd416221_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "Ilona Szabó de Carvalho designs solutions for some of the world's biggest challenges -- from reducing violence and reforming drug laws to renewing democracy and fighting polarization.", "whylisten": "

Ilona Szabó de Carvalho is the cofounder and executive director of the Igarapé Institute, a "think-and-do" tank based in Brazil. She also cofounded Agora, a political movement of young leaders advancing innovative, evidence-based public policy. In her work, she tackles issues like responsible firearms regulation, criminal justice and progressive drug policy. She coordinated the Global Commission on Drug Policy from 2011-2016, reaching out to presidents, business leaders and civic groups to rethink the war on drugs. 
  
In addition to her column with Folha de Sao Paulo, Szabó de Carvalho is the author of Drugs: The Untold Stories and Public Security to Change the Game. In 2014, she gave her first TED Talk, and in 2015, she was nominated to be a Young Global Leader at the World Economic Forum.

"}], "speaker_name": "Ilona Szabó de Carvalho", "tags": ["Brazil", "global issues", "policy", "violence", "guns", "narcotics"], "title": "4 lessons I learned from taking a stand against drugs and gun violence", "video_type": {"id": "1", "name": "TED Stage Talk"}, "viewed_count": 1197787}]}
author: Ilona_Szabó de Carvalho;
title: 4 lessons I learned from taking a stand against drugs and gun violence
